awd_titl_txt: I-Corps: Swarm Three Dimensional Printing and Assembly Platform
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is to accelerate the development and adoption of 3D printing technologies for industry use. Although 3D printing has been increasingly implemented in various industries, its broad adoption has been impeded by the limited 3D printing capabilities and high cost. This I-Corps project will explore the market potential of a new swarm 3D printing and assembly (SPA) platform, which employs a swarm of mobile 3D printers and robots to cooperate for digital manufacturing. Due to the modularity, flexibility, and reconfigurability, the SPA platform can significantly increase 3D printing capabilities at relatively low cost, which will facilitate the adoption of 3D printing and digital manufacturing technologies in different industries, such as construction, architecture, film, and medical industries. The SPA platform can be used to build a network of digital factories to provide on-demand customized digital manufacturing to different industries around the globe, establishing a digital manufacturing infrastructure for society.

This I-Corps project further develops a novel digital manufacturing system, the swarm 3D printing and assembly (SPA) platform, which expands the current 3D printing capabilities at relatively low cost. The SPA platform consists of many individual printhead-carrying mobile robots working together to print and assemble products based on digital models. Compared to traditional 3D printing technologies that print materials layer by layer with a single 3D printer, the SPA platform will first divide the print job into smaller printing tasks using a chunking algorithm and assign them to different robots, which are then wirelessly coordinated by a scheduling algorithm to complete the printing tasks in parallel and in sequence while avoiding collisions. Results from research on both the hardware and software platform demonstrate the promise of this technology. Objects with dimensions larger than the printers themselves have already been successfully printed.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
The objective of this I-Corps project is to evaluate the market opportunity of the Swarm 3D Printing and Assembly (SPA) technology. Inspired by nature, similar to how a swarm of bees working together to build their beehives, SPA employs a swarm of mobile manufacturing robots to manufacture products based on digital models cooperatively. The ultimate vision of the project is to develop a model of a general-purpose digital factory for on-demand customized production with autonomous mobile robots. This factory model can be replicated in communities around the world to create a network of smart factories as a digital manufacturing infrastructure such that on-demand, customized manufacturing becomes affordable. Similar to how the infrastructure of the electricity grid and the Internet transformed society, this envisioned digital manufacturing infrastructure will enable product designers and entrepreneurs to bring their products to customers without being discouraged by the complexity and cost of production and supply chain management, making it easier and more economically viable to test innovative business ideas. The SPA platform provides a critical first step towards this vision.

Supported by this NSF I-Corps award, we have conducted over 400 customer interviews to evaluate the market opportunities of the SPA technologies across three industries, including construction, aerospace, and rapid prototyping. A product-market fit was identified in the architectural precast industry by providing SPA platform for formwork manufacturing. AMBOTS was incorporated to further develop and commercialize the SPA technology. The progress has received wide recognitions around the world, such as the ?3D Startup of the Year? by 3Dnatives, ?The Five Coolest Things on Earth This Week? by General Electric, and being featured on CBS Innovation Nation.

 

 


Last Modified: 02/28/2022
Modified by: Wenchao Zhou
